task.title: [MCP] Klaviyo

data.title: [MCP] Klaviyo
data.body:
## üß© Product Overview

Klaviyo is a marketing automation platform for email, SMS, and customer data.  
This integration enables AI agents and workflows to create, manage, and interact with profiles, lists, events, campaigns, and segments, automating customer engagement and analytics.

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Note for Contributors

To ensure consistency and maintainability, this feature must be submitted as a [Piece](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/piece-definition) following the Activepieces architecture. Submissions that do not follow this format will not be accepted. Please make sure to review the [Piece Development Guidelines](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview) before starting development.

---

## üö® Triggers

| **Trigger** | **Use Case** |
|-------------|---------------|
| **New Profile** | Triggers when a new profile is created in the account. |
| **Profile Added to List/Segment** | Fires when a profile is added to a specific list or segment. |

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Write Actions

| **Action Item** | **Use Case** |
|-----------------|---------------|
| **Create Profile** | Add a new user profile to Klaviyo, optionally subscribing to email/SMS. |
| **Update Profile** | Update existing profile data and preferences. |
| **Subscribe Profile** | Subscribe a profile to email or SMS lists. |
| **Unsubscribe Profile** | Remove a profile from email or SMS lists. |
| **Add Profile to List** | Add a profile to a specific list. |
| **Remove Profile from List** | Remove a profile from a specific list. |
| **Create List** | Create a new subscriber list. |

---

## üîç Search Actions

| **Action Item** | **Use Case** |
|-----------------|---------------|
| **Find Profile by Email/Phone** | Locate a profile using email or phone number. |
| **Find List by Name** | Look up a list by name to get its ID. |
| **Find Tag by Name** | Locate a tag to manage tagging workflows. |

---

## üìö API Reference

- [Official Klaviyo API Documentation](https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference)

---

## üß™ Test Account Access

You can test Klaviyo APIs by creating a free account on [Klaviyo](https://www.klaviyo.com/) and generating a private API key from your account settings.

---

## üßë‚Äçüíª New to Activepieces?

Activepieces is the leading open source AI automation platform. We have many apps (we call them Pieces), that are available within the builder and as MCPs. These apps are built with our TypeScript framework and are easy to develop. Once merged into our repository, they become available as pieces in our automation builder and as MCPs usable by AI agents and MCP clients.

Start building here: [Piece Development Docs](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview)

task.title: [MCP] Canva

data.title: [MCP] Canva
data.body:
## üß© Product Overview  

Canva is an online design platform that enables users to create visual content like social graphics, presentations, and posters. This integration empowers automation builders and AI agents to streamline tasks such as design creation, asset uploads, exports, folder organization, and more.

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Note for Contributors  

To ensure consistency and maintainability, this feature must be submitted as a [Piece](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/piece-definition) following the Activepieces architecture. Submissions that do not follow this format will not be accepted. Please make sure to review the [Piece Development Guidelines](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview) before starting development.

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Write Actions  

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **Upload Asset** | Auto-upload brand assets when a campaign starts. |
| **Create Design** | Automatically generate Instagram templates on new blog posts.|
| **Import Design** | Convert user-submitted PDFs into editable Canva designs. |
|**Export Design**| Export a brochure as a PDF and save it.|
|**Move Folder Item**| Organize completed designs into an ‚ÄúArchive‚Äù folder.|

---

## üîç Search Actions  

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case**                                                                                                                                     |
|:------------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Find Design** | Ensure a design doesn‚Äôt already exist before creation.|

---

## üìñ Read Actions

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case**                                                                                                                                     |
|:------------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Get a Folder** | Retrieves details about an existing folder.|
|**Get an Image**| Retrieves details about an existing image.|

---

## üìö API Reference  
- [Official Canva API Documentation](https://www.canva.dev/docs/connect/api-reference/designs/create-design/)

---

## üß™ Test Account Access  
You can sign up for a free account at https://www.canva.com/en_in/.

---

## üßë‚Äçüíª New to Activepieces?

Activepieces is the leading open source AI automation platform. We have many apps (we call them Pieces), that are available within the builder and as MCPs. These apps are built with our TypeScript framework and are easy to develop. Once merged into our repository, they become available as pieces in our automation builder and as MCPs usable by AI agents and MCP clients.

Start building here: [Piece Development Docs](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview)

task.title: [MCP] Gmail

data.title: [MCP] Gmail
data.body:
## üß© Product Overview  

Gmail is Google‚Äôs email platform for sending, receiving, labeling, archiving, and organizing messages.
This integration empowers AI agents and workflows to automate email-based processes, from detection to response, labeling, and thread management.


---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Note for Contributors  

This Gmail piece already exists in Activepieces. Your task is to extend the current piece by adding additional actions and triggers as outlined in the documentation and reference materials.
Please avoid duplicating existing functionality. Review the current implementation before making changes, and ensure that all new features follow existing coding patterns and standards.

---

## üö® Triggers  

| **Trigger** | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **New Starred Email** | Fires when an email is starred (within 2 days).|
| **New Conversation** | Fires when a new conversation (thread) begins.|
|**New Attachment**|Fires when an email with an attachment arrives (with optional filters).|
|**New Label**|Triggers when a new label is created.|
---

## üõ†Ô∏è Write Actions  

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **Reply to Email** | Reply within an existing thread, maintaining context. |
| **Create Draft Reply** | Generate a reply draft within an existing thread.|
| **Add Label to Email** | Attach a label to an individual email.|
|**Remove Label from Email**|Remove a specific label from an email.Remove a specific label from an email.|
|**Create Label**|Create a new user label in Gmail.|
|**Archive Email**|Archive (move to ‚ÄúAll Mail‚Äù) rather than deleting.|
|**Delete Email**|Permanently move an email to Trash.|
|**Remove Label from Thread**|Strip a label from all emails in a thread.|
---

## üîç Search Actions  

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case**                                                                                                                                     |
|:------------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Find Email** | Locate a specific email using search keywords like subject, sender, or content.|

---


## üìö API Reference  
- [Official Gmail API Documentation](https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/guides)

---

## üß™ Test Account Access  
You can test Gmail APIs using a Google account with enabled Gmail API in a [Google Cloud Project Console](https://console.cloud.google.com/).

---

## üßë‚Äçüíª New to Activepieces?

Activepieces is the leading open source AI automation platform. We have many apps (we call them Pieces), that are available within the builder and as MCPs. These apps are built with our TypeScript framework and are easy to develop. Once merged into our repository, they become available as pieces in our automation builder and as MCPs usable by AI agents and MCP clients.

Start building here: [Piece Development Docs](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview)

task.title: [Enhancement]: Add additional server support for Debian 13

data.title: [Enhancement]: Add additional server support for Debian 13
data.body: ### Request Type New Feature ### Description Right now Coolify doesn't validate additional servers that runs Debian 13 because it throws the error "Unsupported OS type for prerequisites installation" Requirements: - Make Coolify validate servers that is running Debian 13 while connecting them to Coolify. - Before you start implementing this feature for the bounty you must share your implementation plan below in the comments.

task.body: ### Request Type New Feature ### Description Right now Coolify doesn't validate additional servers that runs Debian 13 because it throws the error "Unsupported OS type for prerequisites installation" Requirements: - Make Coolify validate servers that is running Debian 13 while connecting them to Coolify. - Before you start implementing this feature for the bounty you must share your implementation plan below in the comments.

task.title: [Enhancement]: WordPress + OpenLiteSpeed service template

data.title: [Enhancement]: WordPress + OpenLiteSpeed service template
data.body:
### Request Type

Improvement

### Description

Following up on the discussion in #8255 (which was closed to split the scope into two dedicated issues).
As a web agency (Mediastar Web), we manage multiple WordPress sites for clients and we're evaluating Coolify as our central hosting platform. One area where we're missing structured support is a production-ready reference setup for running WordPress on OpenLiteSpeed.
What we'd like to see:
- A reusable service template or stack for WordPress + OpenLiteSpeed, following the existing Coolify template patterns
- Persistent volumes for WordPress files and database data
- Compatibility with Coolify's built-in proxy

task.body:

Improvement

### Description

As a web agency (Mediastar Web), we manage multiple WordPress sites for clients and we're evaluating Coolify as our central hosting platform. One area where we're missing structured support is a production-ready reference setup for running WordPress on OpenLiteSpeed.
What we'd like to see:
- A reusable service template or stack for WordPress + OpenLiteSpeed, following the existing Coolify template patterns
- Persistent volumes for WordPress files and database data
- Compatibility with Coolify's built-in proxy

task.title: [Enhancement]: Add a reusable email server stack/template for managing client email domains

data.title: [Enhancement]: Add a reusable email server stack/template for managing client email domains
data.body:
### Request Type

Improvement

### Description

Following up on the discussion in #8255 (which was closed to split the scope into two dedicated issues).
As a web agency (Mediastar Web), we manage email services for multiple client domains and we're evaluating Coolify as our central hosting platform. One area where we're missing structured support is a straightforward way to host and manage client email domains through a reusable template or stack.
What we'd like to see:
- A reusable service template/stack for a self-hosted email server (e.g., based on Docker Mailserver, Mailu, or a similar well-maintained project)
- Persistent volumes for mailboxes, configuration, and certificates
- Compatibility with Coolify's proxy and certificate management

task.body:
### Request Type

Improvement

### Description

Following up on the discussion in #8255 (which was closed to split the scope into two dedicated issues).
As a web agency (Mediastar Web), we manage email services for multiple client domains and we're evaluating Coolify as our central hosting platform. One area where we're missing structured support is a straightforward way to host and manage client email domains through a reusable template or stack.
What we'd like to see:
- A reusable service template/stack for a self-hosted email server (e.g., based on Docker Mailserver, Mailu, or a similar well-maintained project)
- Persistent volumes for mailboxes, configuration, and certificates
- Compatibility with Coolify's proxy and certificate management

task.title: [Enhancement]: Add Open Replay

data.title: [Enhancement]: Add Open Replay
data.body:
### Request Type

New Service

### Description

[Open Replay](https://openreplay.com/) requires [running a installing script](https://docs.openreplay.com/en/deployment/deploy-docker/#deploy-openreplay) that will "create" the final docker compose file. It would be cool to have open replay as a "one click" (coolify service template) service in coolify.

task.body:

New Service

### Description

[Open Replay](https://openreplay.com/) requires [running a installing script](https://docs.openreplay.com/en/deployment/deploy-docker/#deploy-openreplay) that will "create" the final docker compose file. It would be cool to have open replay as a "one click" (coolify service template) service in coolify.

task.title: [Enhancement]: OAUTH only self registering.

data.title: [Enhancement]: OAUTH only self registering.
data.body:
### Request Type

Improvement

### Description

Hi, there!

Today users are only able to self-register with OAUTH2 when general self-register is enabled.

The improvement would be:
- Allow users logging in with OAUTH2 accounts to self-register even when general self-registering is disabled;
- Allow admins to restrict users to OAUTH2 only, blocking users from creating and using passwords if they are coming from an OAUTH2 provider (this would allow a single action to suspend users in multiple Coolify instances);

This would allow us to, for example, control who can and cannot login into a Coolify instance using a tool like Authentik (ex: only users within a certain organization).

The ideal world would be SCIM 2.0 or something like LDAP, but this is a good start to block access whenever someone leaves the team.

Thanks in advance.

task.body:
### Request Type

Improvement

### Description

Hi, there!

Today users are only able to self-register with OAUTH2 when general self-register is enabled.

The improvement would be:
- Allow users logging in with OAUTH2 accounts to self-register even when general self-registering is disabled;
- Allow admins to restrict users to OAUTH2 only, blocking users from creating and using passwords if they are coming from an OAUTH2 provider (this would allow a single action to suspend users in multiple Coolify instances);

This would allow us to, for example, control who can and cannot login into a Coolify instance using a tool like Authentik (ex: only users within a certain organization).

The ideal world would be SCIM 2.0 or something like LDAP, but this is a good start to block access whenever someone leaves the team.

Thanks in advance.

task.title: [Improvement]: Do not share all environment variables across all containers in a Compose project

data.title: [Improvement]: Do not share all environment variables across all containers in a Compose project
data.body:
### Problem Description

When deploying a Docker Compose project, Coolify injects all environment variables into every container, regardless of which container they were defined for.

From inspecting the "Raw Docker compose" in the UI, I believe this happens like this:
  1. A single `.env` file is created containing ALL environment variables from the entire Docker Compose project
  2. This `.env` file is automatically added to every container's `env_file:` directive

### Security Implications

This seems to be a serious security issue. 

Any container in a multi-container Docker Compose project can read the secrets/credentials of every other container.

Examples:
  - In a Next.js + PostgreSQL + Redis stack, the Redis container has access to POSTGRES_PASSWORD and the PostgreSQL container can see OPENAI_API_KEY meant only for the app
  - In any multi-database setup, each database container can see the credentials of other databases
  - If one container is compromised, an attacker gains credentials for all containers in the project

###  Expected Behavior

  Each container should only have access to:
  - Variables explicitly defined in its `environment: ` section
  - Variables from env files explicitly declared in its `env_file:` section
  - Coolify metadata variables (`COOLIFY_*`, `SERVICE_URL_*`, etc.) as needed

Variables specific to other containers (especially credentials) should NOT be accessible to unrelated containers.

### Coolify Version

v4.0.0-beta.452

### Are you using Coolify Cloud?

Yes (Coolify Cloud)

task.title: [Enhancement]: Don't timeout public database proxies after 10 min

data.title: [Enhancement]: Don't timeout public database proxies after 10 min
data.body:
### Request Type

Improvement

### Description

Currently the TCP proxy in front of Postgres when you mark "Expose publicly" times out after about 10m. Switch this to have no timeout or to have a configurable timeout in the GUI.

Use case: I sometimes have `SELECT *` statements that take a very long time (30m+) to download the results for. The connection timing out prevents that from being successful

Bounty: $100 USD once merged and live on Coolify Cloud.

---

This bounty is funded by [Hack Club](https://hackclub.com), a charity that supports teenagers who love coding and electronics! We previously funded database SSL support, backups API, and pgBackRest support for Postgres backups (in progress).

task.title: [Enhancement]: Environment variables for each server that can be made available to each application deployed on it

data.title: [Enhancement]: Environment variables for each server that can be made available to each application deployed on it
data.body:
### Request Type

New Feature

### Description

When deploying a resource using the "Multiple Servers" option, currently there is no way to distinguish between the servers from within the application - because the container running on both servers get identical setup. 

This makes debugging harder as application logs cannot identify which server deployment an issue happened - take for instance a failure due to network errors happening specifically on one server (randomly). 

A way to define Environment variables for each server and making them available for each application deployed on that server, will fix this limitation (and also generalised in a way for use cases beyond what I described here).

task.title: We can't convert Smoothie Board to Circuit JSON

data.title: We can't convert Smoothie Board to Circuit JSON
data.body:
Smoothie Board: https://github.com/freerouting/freerouting/blob/master/tests/Issue145-smoothieboard.dsn
Upload to DSN Viewer: https://dsn.tscircuit.com/

This is probably a pretty hard multi-step issue. Make sure to download freerouting to make sure the snapshot resembles the DSN file.

In addition to the bounty, we will likely tip for steps along the way because doing it in one big PR may be counter-productive.

/bounty $70

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a612114f-df22-434c-80a5-383c9e754ae3)

task.title: Make sure kicad component components create courtyards

data.title: Make sure kicad component components create courtyards
data.body:
In https://kicad-component.tscircuit.com / https://github.com/tscircuit/kicad-component-converter

We need to load the kicad_mod file and produce `<courtyardrect />` elements

- [ ] Find a kicad_mod file to test with that has a courtyard defined
- [ ] Make sure courtyards are drawn in circuit-to-svg
- [ ] Modify kicad-component-converter
- [ ] Modify circuit-json-to-tscircuit


/bounty $75
